section.name: Brief Abstract
section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
This measure is used to assess the proportion of patients with pancreatic, duodenal, or distal biliary tract cancer undergoing surgical resection who die within 30 and 90 days.
This indicator will be reported separately as 30 day mortality and 90 day mortality, as opposed to a single figure.
Note from the National Quality Measures Clearinghouse: This measure is part of the Cancer Quality Performance Indicators (QPIs) collection. For more information, including a complete list of QPI measure sets, please visit the Healthcare Improvement Scotland Web site."/>

<fieldvalue value="
Mortality following resection for hepatopancreatobiliary (HPB) cancer has fallen over the past 30 years and in specialist units should be less than 5% (de Wilde et al., 2012).
Treatment related mortality is a marker of the quality and safety of the whole service provided by the multidisciplinary team (MDT) (NHS Quality Improvement Scotland, 2008)."/>
